Part 1: The Origins 1600-1800

A suite of online programs that cover anatomy, physiology, muscles, the skeleton and the circulatory system through interactive 3D models, animations, quizzes and more.

Availability: 3D visualization 
Date Coverage: Varies

name: VisualDX
description:
Diagnostic clinical decision support system that includes:
-World’s best curated medical image library
-Leading skin of color atlas
-Smart search for chief complaints, diagnoses, and drug reactions
-Custom patient-specific differential diagnosis builder

name: Wall Street Journal, The (1889-2012)
description:
Digital archive of the Wall Street Journal providing access to full-text and full-image articles from the first issue in 1889 through 2002. It includes editorials, analyses, controversial opinions, charts, stock tables, graphics, advertisement and illustrations.

Availability: Full-text
Date Coverage: 1889 - 2012
Note: For issues published after 1999, use ProQuest Central database.

name: Wall Street Journal, The (first-time users must create an account using their AUB email while on-campus)
description:
Availability: Full-text
Date Coverage: 2010 to present
Note: Users of the American University of Beirut have a 90-day expiration cookie placed on their account. This means that if you do not click on the link located in the Libraries’ page within 90 days, you will lose access to the Wall Street Journal. This process was put into place, by WSJ, not only to ensure that legitimate and current students and professors are able to use the site license but also when students leave AUB, their access will automatically drop off as well.
For issues published before 2010, use the following databases:
- ProQuest Central (1998-2010)
- Wall Street Journal – Historical (1889-1998)

name: Washington Post , The (click on "more" for access)
description:
The Washington Post, is an American daily newspaper published in Washington, D.C.
The Post has distinguished itself through its political reporting on the workings of the White House, Congress, and other aspects of the U.S. government.

Coverage: 2024 - Present

name: Washington Post, The (1877-2007)
description:
Digital archive of the Washington Post newspaper providing access to full text from the first issue in 1889 through 1998. It includes editorials, analyses, controversial opinions, charts, stock tables, advertisement, graphics and illustrations.
Availability: Full-text
Date Coverage: 1877-2007
Note: For issues published after 2000, use LexisNexis or ProQuest Central databases.

name: Web of Science
description:
Web of Science, an authoritative and multidisciplinary citation database, allows searching of core journal articles, conference proceedings, data sets, and other resources in the sciences, social sciences, arts, and humanities. Includes current and retrospective coverage dating to 1900. Also features "cited reference" search capabilities.

Availability: Bibliographic citations
Date Coverage: 1900 to present

name: Wellesley Index to Victorian Periodicals, 1824-1900
description:
Index of articles written in Victorian periodicals and published anonymously or under pseudonyms. The main objective of the index was to deliver accurate information on provenance of articles and to identify the authors of articles within 45 Victorian periodicals. The index provides linking between article records, contributor and pseudonym records, and periodical introductions.

Availability: Bibliographic citations
Date Coverage: 1824-1900
Note: The print equivalent is held in Jafet Stacks

name: Western Travellers in the Islamic World
description:
A full-text collection of primary documents published by Brill, offering a representative sample of Western travelogues in English, French, and German published until 1800. Predominantly covering the Ottoman Empire, the collection also stretches into Ethiopia, Central Asia, Afghanistan, Kurdistan, North Africa, and Iran. It includes works written by J.B. Tavernier, John Chardin, James Bruce, and many others.

Availability: Full-text
Date Coverage: Varies

name: Wiley Online Library
description:
Wiley Online Library allows searching of articles from hundreds of electronic journals published by Wiley and related companies, as well as a vast and growing collection of reference works and other books. 115 of the journal titles are accessible from volume one. Content is multidisciplinary .

Availability: Bibliographic citations and selected full-text
Date Coverage: Varies

name: World Biographical Information System Online (WBIS Online)
description:
Biographical database, providing short biographical information on over 6 million people from the 8th century B.C. to present.
The database compiles biographical articles from printed reference works published from the 16th to the 21st century, and reproduces these original documents as facsimile images on the screen.

Availability: Full-text
Date Coverage: Complete collection

name: WorldCat
description:
WorldCat, the OCLC Online Union Catalog is the world's largest bibliographic database. It contains records from libraries worldwide and includes millions of citations for a range of materials including books, chapters, computer programs, films, journals, magazines, manuscripts, newspapers, slides, sound recordings, videotapes and more, in a variety of languages.

Availability: Bibliographic citations
Date Coverage: 1200 to present

name: WRDS (Wharton Research Data Services)
description:
A data research platform and business intelligence tool. WRDS provides the user with one location to access data covering numerous financial, economic and marketing disciplines including Accounting, Banking, Economics, ESG, Finance, Healthcare, Insurance, Marketing, and Statistics.

Availability: Statistical data
Date Coverage: Varies
Note: First time users will need to register.
